result.execSummary:
The defendant Adrian J Ramirez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.

Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation.

Pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, during the term of probation.  Any unpaid amount results in a civil judgment. 
Restitution set at $0.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adrian J Ramirez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adrian J Ramirez in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 1: Defendant ordered to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, credit of 4 days time served, Huber privileges for work and school. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:

- Serve 90 days in the House of Correction as a condition time sentence with release for work and school, STAYED, to be used at discretion of Probation Agent.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- No further violations of the law.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Restitution set at $0. 
- Pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, during the term of probation.  Any unpaid amount results in a civil judgment. 

Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for 6 months. 

Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Jury Instructions 2630
At request of defense counsel, 08-04-2022 plea/sentencing hearing is moved from 9:00 am to 1:30 pm, Branch 2 room 635 courthouse.

Defendant Adrian J Ramirez in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Mark L Thomsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Adrian J Ramirez in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Domask appeared by video means. Case was mistabbed to branch 45. Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated June 3, 2022 - received

Defendant Adrian J Ramirez in court in person with Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask who appears by video.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Adrian J Ramirez in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Adrian J Ramirez in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adrian J Ramirez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
